intro: Caputia scaposa var. addoensis, commonly known as the Addo rock rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in summer, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in the Addo Elephant National Park and surrounding areas.
